text: Coon Creek is a stream in Jasper and Barton counties of southwest Missouri. It is a tributary of the North Fork Spring River. The stream headwaters are in northeast Jasper County at and the confluence with the North Fork Spring River is at . The stream source is located southwest of Dudenville and it flows to the northwest and then west crossing the Jasper–Barton county line several times before flowing into the North Fork Spring River in southern Barton County after passing under U. S. Route 71 about one mile north of Jasper.Missouri Atlas & Gazetteer, DeLorme, 1998, First edition, p. 50, Jasper, Missouri, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1962Maple Grove, Missouri, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1962 Coon Creek was named after the raccoon native to the area. ==See also== *List of rivers of Missouri ==References== Category:Rivers of Barton County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Jasper County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Missouri
title: Coon Creek (Spring River tributary)
